Content:: L. H. Sudath Manjula (born 10 December 1972) is a Sri Lankan politician and Member of Parliament.[1] Manjula was born on 10 December 1972.[1] He was educated at Ruwanwella Rajasinghe Maha Vidyalaya.[2] Manjula was a member of Ruwanwella Divisional Council.[2] He was arrested in December 2013 over an alleged assault of a Department of Archaeology employee.[3][4] He contested the 2020 parliamentary election as a Sri Lanka People's Freedom Alliance electoral alliance candidate in Kegalle District and was elected to the Parliament of Sri Lanka.[5][6][7]  This article about a politician from Sabaragamuwa Province, Sri Lanka is a stub. You can help Wikipedia by expanding it.
